intro: Tithymalus montenegrinus, commonly known as the Montenegrin tithymalus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in parts of its native range.
